title: Why numbers?
content: Numbers are some of the most basic things that most if not all programming languages can understand. This is great, because humans also know numbers quite well! This can be a great bridge into the world of the unknown (aka JavaScript) and something you already know.

content: Yup! Subtraction is exactly the same in JavaScript as well. Let's move on to multiplication and division, this is where things get interesting...

title: Multiplication in JavaScript
content: So in JavaScript multiplication is using the asterisks or "*" symbol instead of the traditional "x". All the rules of multiplication are the same, just the sign is different.

title: What about BEDMAS?
content: If you've never heard of BEDMAS, it's an acronym to help you remember the order of algebraic operations. The order goes Brackets (B), Exponents (E), Division (D), Multiplication (M), Addition (A) and Subtraction (S). This order is also respected when doing mathematical operations in JavaScript
